item.title: Report X-2023100231
item.description:
Report X-2023100231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON FLOOR IN TUGGER AREA APPROX 5 AM. PACKAGE WAS OPENED TO INSPECT CONTENTS. CONTENTS WERE 4 PLASTIC 1 GAL JUGS OF REAGENT ALCOHOL. ONE OF THE JUGS HAD A SMALL PUNCTURE UNDERNEATH THE HANDLE SEAM, FOUND DURING INSPECTION. NO OTHER DAMAGE OCCURRED. PACKAGE TAKEN AWAY AND SET ASIDE ON QA CART DescribePack: 1 SMALL HOLE IN SEAM, UNDER JUG HANDLE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN AWAY FROM AREA AND SET ASIDE ON QA CART

item.title: Report X-2023100192
item.description:
Report X-2023100192

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package went out for delivery, but was unable to be delivered due to customer not being available to receive it. It was brought back to station, where it was later discovered to be leaking. Package was then contained in a red hazmat tote and was dealt with accordingly. DescribePack: Leakage was due to cap failure. Caps were loose and spillage happened, causing the caps to corrode so they no longer turn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediate containment

item.title: Report X-2023100155
item.description:
Report X-2023100155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat bucket was incorrectly placed onto the IC belt which resulted in the bucket falling off onto lid and breaking seal, allowing solution to leak. QA responded by placing the bucket into a red hazmat tote with a blue liner using hazmat gloves as this solution is corrosive. DescribePack: The package failed at the seal, the lid came off slightly and when attempting to correct it, the rubber seal would not snap back into place leading to leakage of solution from top of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The liquid that had released was cleaned up off of the ground, the bucket was placed in a tote with a liner and covered to prevent contact with anything else.
